final_poem:
The clock’s hands drown in midnight’s ink,  
A hollow hum where your voice once spun.  
The wind, a thief, steals every brink  
Of memory, leaving only the sun  
To bleach the edges of what’s gone.  

I trace the ghost of your hand in dust,  
A silhouette that fades with each breath.  
The stars, they hum a dirge, unjust—  
A silent sky, too vast to confess  
The weight of absence, sharp and deep.  

The moon, a pall, hangs low and pale,  
A mirror to the ache inside.  
I clutch the void, a silent tale  
Of love that frays, yet won’t subside.  
In every shadow, you still abide.
